[Enterprise Only] Allows direct login to MODV
Requests a new JWT that is valid for the next 30 minutes
Gets a personal access token for the current user

post.description: Creates a personal access token for the current user

get.description: Gets a one time token for the current user

Once a user has been authenticated with Auth0 they will be given a JWT token. This token is used to authorise against the MODV API and is exchanged for a JWT token that is used for all future requests.

delete.description: Logs the current user out of the system

get.description: Gets the current user's profile

put.description: Updates the current user's header image

get.description: Gets the current user's header image

Gets the current user's disk usage
Searches for vaults, folders and documents
Searches for documents
Gets the recently updated documents
Searches for users

Retrieves a list of all vault objects that the user has access to, the response object is organised into a structure of users. Where the first element in the array response is always yourself, and subsequent elements contain vaults/folders/documents that were permissioned to you.

post.description: Create one or more root level objects. Only the name needs to be supplied and the name needs to be unique within the users account.

put.description: Update one or more root level objects. Only the name needs to be supplied and the name needs to be unique within the users account.
